channel.title: Moparscape Newbie--I need Help
channel.description:
Hey, I just downloaded moparscape today, and I've got the basics down (editing .cfg files, and such), and I have a programming background (like javascript, vb, python, etc.) I'm interesting in modding, but I'm having a few difficulties:
1) I need to know which IDE or program can view the CLASS and java files for moparscape (just a few names of ones that will work) 2) client.java - I cannot seem to find this file. Is it the clienthandler class file?
I know these are newbie questions, but if I could just get a little help here, I'll be modding like crazy.

item.title: Moparscape Newbie--I need Help
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

I didn’t type up that huge post for nothing.
Read it, understand it, learn from it, and that’s that.
When you’re done, I have to agree with Budda and Codesoft and you might want to consider reading basic Java tutorials. Learning basic Java helps in many ways. Really, I suggest doing it.

Thanks telenubby--that's exactly what I needed -- just one question though: You say that the client.java is an extention of the players class- do I have to paste it into the source of players, or if I just compile client.java and place it in the same folder as the players class will it work? Well, thanks for your help.

And Buddha, plz, I’m asking for help, not critisism–I know what I’m doing, I was just confused on a few matters. Try helping next time instead of insulting.


You don’t have to paste anything into anything. Infact, I even suggest staying away from and copy and paste tutorials. They are the opposite of originality and ruin private servers. I was just giving an example earlier. Leave the classes how they are and don’t combine them or anything.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape Newbie--I need Help
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

akgamer0615:

Thanks, Telenubby; i found a client.java file in one of the other servers i downloaded–how do I use this with moparscape? Do I have do do any decompiling? Do I have to decompile Moparscape, edit the file, and recompile it? Sorry, I’m not used to Java

It’s not really Java, it’s the setup of a RuneScape Private Server.

This is how it works. I’m sure you’ll understand if you really do have a background knowledge in basic programming.

The client, for example MoparScape client, is a special tool while playing a server. Each button you press, each time you click, a packet is created and sent to the server. If you click on an NPC, a certain packet is sent to the server and identified. If you click on the floor and start to walk, it tells the server through a packet. Without a client, you could not play the server.

The server is what handles everything the client tells it. All of the packets are handled in the server. The client class, which is the cramped up class, is an extension of the class Player, which handles everything to do with the player that logged into the server. If you wanted to, you could move everything from client.java into Player.java. That’s why it’s an extension. It even says “extends Player” at the top of client.java.

The client class handles a lot of things. Quests, dialogues, information and text on side bars, chatting, etc. Why? Because in most servers it has the parseIncomingPackets() method. This method has a simple switch statement which handles every single packet that you tell it to. Packets are identifed by numbers. For example, packet 103 is the command packet. Anything you type into the client chatbox that has a prefix of a double-colon is sent to the server through packet 103. The server then parses that packet and String and performs the command, or action, you want it to. The parseIncomingPackets() is a large method, and instead of creating seperate classes to handle these packets, the early users of private servers decided to cramp it all in the client class. Unforunately, nobody has decided to change this. So we all got used to it. I recommend you use handlers, though. It’ll help a lot with organization, neatness, and sometimes lag.

Each Java file makes up the source code for your server. The Java compiler, javac.exe, works like the C++ compiler, or any other language compiler. It compiles your source code, making smaller files out of it, just like compression tools like WinZip and WinRar. The Java executor/runner tool, java.exe, uses these class files to run a program. In this case, the server. Class files are not editable, but if you would like to re-create the source code out of these files, you may use a Java decompiler like JAD (free 3rd party program). The re-created source code will not be 100% accurate, but over time, the decompiling process has developed enough for it to be a very close re-construction of source code.

To make changes in a private server, simply make any changes you want in the source code (.JAVA files), and then compile it with the JDK compiler (javac.exe). Then run the class file (the main one should be server.java) that starts up the server with java.exe in your JDK/bin directory, and ta-dah. You got yourself a running server.

Hope I helped.

Read full topic

  2. Some decent (and by decent, i mean -2 on a scale of 1 - 10 instead of -5) servers are set out differently, files renamed and shit.

[quote=“akgamer0615, post:1, topic:165425”]Hey, I just downloaded moparscape today, and I’ve got the basics down (editing .cfg files, and such), and I have a programming background (like javascript, vb, python, etc.)
I’m interesting in modding, but I’m having a few difficulties:

  1. I need to know which IDE or program can view the CLASS and java files for moparscape (just a few names of ones that will work)
  2. client.java - I cannot seem to find this file. Is it the clienthandler class file?

I know these are newbie questions, but if I could just get a little help here, I’ll be modding like crazy.[/quote]

item.title: Moparscape Newbie--I need Help
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

You don’t view class files. You first decompile them with a 3rd party program, something like JAD, and then view the new source file created from the compilation. A Java file is compiled into a Class file, while Class files are the ones run by JDK. Notepad works fine when viewing Java files, but if you want to go more IDE like, I reccommend TextPad. It’s free.

Client.java is a Java file found in most servers. Take a look at our download section, find a server that looks amusing, and download it. Most users here use client.java for basically all of their edits. They cram everything up in there, sadly. So, if I were you, I would stay away from that. Create proper handlers, and there are tutorials for making handlers around here. You can find the client.java in the server you download, I garuntee it.

Good luck modding.

stop spamming,the client is a .txt file so its a notepad
You, my friend, are an idiot. You have no clue what you are talking about, and therefore breaking one of the rules of the Terms of Service on Moparscape.org. You must know what you are talking about before you post. Clearly, you do not.

Read full topic
